pinyin: Xie1 luo4 ke4 · Fu2 er3 mo2 si1

definition: to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
surname Luo/old name of several rivers (in Henan, Shaanxi, Sichuan and Anhui)
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1859-1930), author of the Sherlock Holmes stories 歇洛克·福爾摩斯|歇洛克·福尔摩斯
Scott (name)/Sir Walter Scott (1771-1832), Scottish romantic novelist

pinyin: A1 jia1 sha1 · Ke4 li3 si1 di4

definition: Sherlock Holmes, 歇洛克·福爾摩斯|歇洛克·福尔摩斯[Xie1 luo4 ke4 · Fu2 er3 mo2 si1]
James Joyce (1882-1941), Irish modernist writer, author of Ulysses and Finnegans Wake
pinyin: Zhan1 mu3 si1 · Qiao2 yi1 si1

definition: Edgar Allen Poe (1809-1849), American poet and novelist
pinyin: Ai1 de2 jia1 · Ai4 lun2 · Po1

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
